Description: Handle-plate of Attic black-figured pottery column-krater with part of handle; underside glazed streaky black; top: black-figure decoration consisting of man's head with face and neck in added red to left; red band around edge of handle plate.
Dimensions: Thickness: 1.20 centimetres (front edge of handle plate)
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
According to Venit, this sherd is by the same hand as British Museum 1886,0401.1230 and Fitzwilliam Cambridge GR.188.1899; two of these handle plates probably come from the same column krater.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 270, no. B209)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0138) (Phase 1)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
